occupation: Advisory Board Member for Network of Excellence in Women’s Health at Imperial College London
headline: Author of Unlocking Women's Health, FemTech & the Quest for Gender Equity - Global Women's Health Leader - Founder FemHealth Insights, Host of FemTech Focus Podcast - Scientist - Investor - Speaker - Consultant
summary:
Every day Dr. Barreto dedicates her work to advancing women’s health by equipping founders, investing in innovative ideas, and engaging key stakeholders to create better healthcare for women, females, and girls, an industry known as FemTech. She is the Founder and Chief Innovation Officer of FemHealth Insights, Host of the FemTech Focus Podcast, Co-Founder of Coyote Ventures, Advisory Board Member for Johnson Center for Entrepreneurship and Innovation at Indiana University, and an unconventional scientist, entrepreneur, and consultant that proves that anything is possible with hard work and heart. 

Her journey in women's health began as a distributor and educator for Athena's Home Novelties (SexTech). She has engaged in HHMI-funded research on potential correlations between Estrogen and Alzheimer's, which disproportionately affects women. While finishing her doctorate in Genetics, she founded a venture-backed startup, Pheramor, the world's first DNA-based dating app. The algorithm incorporated factors that increase sexual compatibility and fertility between matches. Dr. Barreto also co-founded WeHaveChemistry, a web-based product for couples to discover their love alchemy. She exited the two companies and shifted into investments as Senior Venture Associate and launched Capital Factory's Gulf Coast branch. Under Dr. Barreto’s leadership, the Houston accelerator portfolio grew by an impressive 205%. 

Dr. Barreto noticed how underserved the women's health (femtech) industry was and set out to bring awareness, resources, and capital to it. She hosts the #1 femtech podcast, FemTech Focus, co-founded an early-stage femtech investment firm, Coyote Ventures, and founded FemHealth Insights, a boutique consulting firm with a market research software tool specializing in women's health innovation. She is considered the voice of femtech and is a 3x recipient of Top Leaders in FemTech. Dr. Barreto has served on women’s health committees with Gates Foundation, NIH, and HLTH. She is a FemTech Forbes contributor and hosts a tech column in HealthyWomen magazine. She is invited internationally to speak on the past, present, and future of women’s health innovation. She is revered by pharma, retail, and private equity as the go-to expert on all things femhealth and femtech.

experiences.title: Advisory Board Member for Network of Excellence in Women’s Health
experiences.description:
Imperial Multi-Faculty Networks of Excellence aim to establish and grow connections around an important multidisciplinary area being explored at early stages. Currently, Imperial has 29 multi-faculty centers of excellence with women's health being one of the newest.

The Women’s Health Network of Excellence is a multi-faculty network of staff, students, and external partners interested in women’s health. Our mission is to promote interdisciplinary research and innovation in women’s health and gender-based health equity. The purpose of the Advisory Board is to provide independent guidance on the Network’s direction and priorities regarding research and education agendas as well as activities related to community engagement and involvement, policy, and capacity-building.

I am proud to advise the network of excellence alongside:
-Dame Lesley Regan, Women's Health Ambassador for England
-Prof Robyn Norton, Co-Founder & Director of The George Institute for Global Health
-Prof Sarah Fidler, Professor of HIV & Communicable Diseases at Imperial
-Prof Anita Charlesworth, Chief Economist of the Health Foundation
-Dr Annabel Sowemimo, Community Sexual & Reproductive Health Registrar in the NHS

experiences.title: Chief Innovation Officer, Founder
experiences.description:
Our team at FemHealth Insights specializes in women’s health innovation. With extensive experience in numerous healthcare verticals and stakeholders, we provide a more comprehensive understanding of the market — so you can make the right decisions for your business.
The FemHealth Insights platform includes 1300+ companies across all health verticals and product types

Leveraging our accurate, early-stage company data and multi-dimensional analysis, you'll be able to evaluate the FemHealth landscape, predict trends, identify market gaps, connect directly with founders, and more.

experiences.title: Innovation Equity Forum, Chair of the Innovation Committee
experiences.description:
Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and the National Institutes of Health initiated an inclusive, consultative, cross-sector effort to generate a Women’s Health Innovation Opportunity Map as a collaborative framework to advance women’s health innovation. A Forum of over 250 experts and stakeholders were recruited to participate—representing over 50 countries and diverse perspectives across various geographic regions and sectors that work in women’s health. Members were organized into 11 sub-committees that identified and developed opportunities within each topic. Dr. Barreto served as the Chair of the Innovation Committee and took the lead on group discussions, in-person brainstorming, and final reporting of the Innovation Committee's suggestions. We evaluated opportunities against five criteria (PRIME) and formulated actionable solution strategies to
realize each opportunity.

experiences.title: Podcast Host, Founder
experiences.description: FemHealth Insights' podcast is all things women's health innovation. Hosted by Dr. Brittany Barreto, the FemTech Focus podcast engages people supporting, investing, and innovating in the FemHealth market to talk about present innovations and the future of female health and wellness.

experiences.title: Forbes Women Contributor - Women's Health Innovation / FemTech
experiences.description: ForbesWomen is the dedicated source for all Forbes’ coverage of women who are changing the world through business, offering inspiration and tools for ambitious and entrepreneurial-minded women. Dr. Barreto is a femtech contributor covering all things women's health innovation and the business potential behind innovating for over half the population.

experiences.title: FemTech Contributor
experiences.description:
Monthly Contributor to my own dedicated FemTech Column highlighting femtech products and services available to women to improve their health and wellness.
HealthyWomen is dedicated to educating women in the middle — ages 35 to 64 — so they can make informed health decisions, advocate for themselves and prioritize their health and wellness. We achieve our mission of educating women to make informed health choices by connecting with women through fact-based, expert-sourced content, and creative evidence-based programming. We keep women's health part of the national dialogue by raising awareness to decision makers about the impact health policy has on women and families. And we work collaboratively with partner organizations and alliances to reach more women.

experiences.title: Co-Founder, Advisor
experiences.description: Coyote Ventures is a Seed-stage venture fund in the US to invest in companies innovating in women’s health and wellness, founded by scientists and industry experts, and supporting founders leveraging our thousand-plus member network and media platform FemTech Focus.

experiences.title: Co-Founder, Instructor
experiences.description: Founder’s Compass is a dynamic monthly business program taught by experienced founders for aspiring entrepreneurs & early-stage (pre-seed) founders looking to develop a firm foundation and be prepared for the next steps in growing your business. We are business founders teaching other founders all our street-smarts.

experiences.title: Senior Venture Associate
experiences.description: Capital Factory's first Houston-based hire to build its Gulf Coast portfolio. Capital Factor is the most active late-stage accelerator and venture fund in Texas, with existing offices in Austin and Dallas. Dr. Barreto was hired to launch, operate, and accelerate the Houston-based GulfCoast Branch of the program. She recruited 30+ companies into the late-stage accelerator and led seven investments. She supported Fund VI's fundraising through LP relations and managed a five-person Houston office team. Today, the Houston office is a thriving program at Capital Factory based on Barreto's leadership and the firm foundation she led the groundwork.

experiences.title: CEO, Cofounder
experiences.description: WeHaveChemistry is a web-based product for couples to discover their love alchemy. We can predict sexual satisfaction through a DNA-test for HLA genes and socio-emotional alignment with a psychology questionnaire written by Dr. Laura Berman. We offer couples an inside look at their chemistry through their DNA and SEA reports. We suggest blogs, podcasts, products, and services most useful to the couple through an AI algorithm based on the results of their tests.

experiences.title: CEO, Co-Founder
experiences.description: Pheramor aims to enhance dating romance through genetics and technology. Our vision is to empower individuals through customized results and personal genetics. This will increase their efficiency and precision of finding a partner they are attracted to and connect with.

experiences.title: PhD Student
experiences.description: Doctoral students in the Molecular and Human Genetics department at Baylor College of Medicine. I worked under Susan M. Rosenberg, PhD studying stress-induced mutagenesis in E.coli.

experiences.title: Consultant
experiences.description: Luminostics is a startup company interested in revolutionizing over the counter diagnostics. Their patented nanotechnology can be used with a customer's smart phone and customized app to test for different diseases or other health metrics. I am currently consulting Luminostics on a new project they are interested in exploring.

experiences.title: Optometrist Medical Technician
experiences.description: Pre-screened patients and recording intake information for doctor. Prepped machines for doctor. Scheduled patient appointments and submitted payments through insurance companies.

education.description:
Trained as an expert in Molecular and Human Genetics. 
Able to design and execute experiments to solve knowledge gaps in the literature.
Received an excellent liberal arts education where I became a well rounded student and learned to articulate my arguments and findings through writing and oral presentations.

accomplishment_publications.name: The Small RNA GcvB promotes Mutagenic Break Repair by Opposing the Membrane Stress Response
accomplishment_publications.description: Microbes and human cells possess mechanisms of mutagenesis activated by stress responses. Stress-inducible mutagenesis mechanisms may provide important models for mutagenesis that drives host-pathogen interactions, antibiotic resistance, and possibly much of evolution generally.  In Escherichia coli, repair of DNA double-strand breaks is switched to a mutagenic mode, using error-prone DNA polymerases, via the SOS DNA-damage and the general (σS) stress responses. We investigated small RNA (sRNA) clients of RNA chaperone Hfq, which promotes mutagenic break repair (MBR), and found that GcvB promotes MBR by allowing a robust σS response, achieved via opposing the membrane stress (σE) response.  First, cells that lack gcvB were MBR-deficient in two standard assays.  Second, ∆gcvB cells displayed reduced σS-dependent transcription in colony and flow-cytometric assays, but not reduced σS-protein levels.  Third, the σS-dependent-transcription and MBR defects of ∆gcvB cells were alleviated by deletion of rssB, which increases σS levels.  These data imply that GcvB promotes mutagenesis by allowing a normal σS response.  Fourth, ∆gcvB cells were highly induced for the σE response.  Moreover, their high σE response underlies their reduced MBR, in that a special σE-response-blocking mutation restored mutagenesis to ∆gcvB cells.  We suggest that GcvB may promote the σS response and mutagenesis indirectly, by promoting membrane integrity, which keeps σE levels lower. At high levels, σE might inhibit σS-dependent transcription by titrating RNA polymerase, to which σS would normally bind, so that σS may be unable to regulate transcription at the normal level. The data show the delicate balance of stress-response modulation of mutagenesis.

accomplishment_publications.name: Double-Strand-Break Repair, Mutagenesis and Stress. In Stress and Environmental Control of Gene Expression in Bacteria

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: HYPE Impact Award; Startup SuperStar
accomplishment_honors_awards.description: The HYPE Impact Awards are presented to outstanding young leaders who strive for excellence and have achieved innovative, business-savvy and ground-breaking ideas.

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: Top 100 Young Executives in America
accomplishment_honors_awards.description:
Produced by The Business Journals, this first-of-its-kind list spotlights 100 younger executives who already are having an impact on business being done in communities across the nation.

And, because they’re still early in their careers, these are executives who could be shaping how business gets done for years to come.

These executives were identified in conjunction with editors and staff writers across The Business Journals’ network of more than 40 publications. The list draws in large part from those publications’ respective Forty Under 40 productions over the past year. From that mass of well more than 1,000 executives who’ve been profiled locally over the past 12 months, the field was narrowed to spotlight the 100 executives you see here.

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: Women Who Mean Business; Woman to Watch
accomplishment_honors_awards.description: Criteria for selection includes career achievement, contribution to company, community involvement and leadership.

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: Houston Business Journal 40 Under 40
accomplishment_honors_awards.description: Winners are chosen by a panel of judges not affiliated with the HBJ. Candidates are evaluated based on professional accomplishments, philanthropic efforts, and other exemplary qualities. The winners are Houston's top 40 businessmen and women in the city of Houston under 40 years of age.

volunteer_work.title: Chairman Of The Board
volunteer_work.description: ​The mission of Cooper's Crossroad is to raise awareness of the profound and insidious effects of trauma by offering seminars, workshops, lectures, and retreats to those interested in becoming educated on its impact and available cutting edge treatment.  We are a non-profit organization set upon 100 pristine acres of farmland, surrounded by nature's beauty, including horses, cows, dogs, and mountain views.

Brittany transmits an amazing energy, gives concrete and actionable advice related to business strategy, and she really knows the FemTech market better than anyone else!
